org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration

Class CartesianLinearTick

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.AxisContainer
      • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.Tick
        • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.CartesianTick
          • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.CartesianNumericTick
            • org.pepstock.charba.client.configuration.CartesianLinearTick
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsLinearTick, IsNumericTick, IsScriptableFontProvider<ScaleContext>

    public class CartesianLinearTick
extends CartesianNumericTick
implements IsLinearTick
    The linear scale is use to chart numerical data.
    It can be placed on either the x or y axis.
    The scatter chart type automatically configures a line chart to use one of these scales for the x axis.
    As the name suggests, linear interpolation is used to determine where a value lies on the axis.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero
